body: it's stylistically interesting, she has nice breasts. the literary detail is nice, but it's a narcissistic tale riffing off don't look now and not really that startling or exciting or well-directed (and as such, not well-acted) but it's cool in a way and less creepy and self-immolating than american detective so I'm glad I gave it the minimum of my full attention.
author: Max Berengaut
title: The Comfort of Strangers
actors: Christopher Walken, Natasha Richardson, Rupert Everett, Helen Mirren
